content.description:
A good route with a technical crux down low and a pumpy crux up high, and I believe the only heel hooking at the crag.

It's the line just right of the obvious arete in the center of the crag. Can be easily identified by the 2 foot long chain hanging down from the roof.

Starts on black featured rock right of 'Blood of the Warrior' and shares last bolt and anchors with said route. Crux beginning leads to more moderate climbing above. Steeper than it looks, like most of the Warrior Wall.

A short and sporty route with just enough protection. A difficult and crimpy start climbs to easier, more sparse terrain.

Bouncy climbing up solid, black rock, only one real crux is evident. The climbing here is fairly straight foward, with a few sucker holds sprinkled in for good measure.

Very short, but worth a run. Usually wet until early August.
content.location:
Silent Warrior

is on the left side of the wall just right of an obvious crack.

Its the left-most and only route with three bolts.

content.description: Short and sweet. Steep route with some reachy moves. Suggest avoiding this wall if it has been raining. Holds can break when wet.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus anchors, wear your helmet
content.location: On the left side of Warrior wall.

content.description: Follow the large black streak to a rest before the anchors.
content.location: Farthest right route on Warrior wall.

content.description: Fairly sustained climbing, with a no hands rest about 3/4 of the way up.
content.location: Start just left of the corner, left of Dog Man.

content.description: Bouldery start leads to a no hands rest, then a tricky move to get on the face above. Stellar!
content.protection: 7 bolts to anchors. A runner is nice for the bolt below the ledge. (3rd I think)
content.location: The obvious arete in the center of the wall. Climb the arete, then up the face on the left.

content.description:
Solid and serious, this multi-crux route hits quick. A tenuous start to a boulderesque crux finishes with a spacious endurance sprint to the chains.

The mid-height crux holds some thin crimps, thin feet, and an unobvious sequence...Hold on!

This route gets afternoon shade and is often wet early to mid-season.
content.protection: Four bolts and an two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Second from the left,

Cry of the Warrior

is the next immediate sport route right of

Silent Warrior

, sharing its anchor.

content.description: A thin start leads to easier climbing above. No hands rest just below the anchors. Climbs a few bolts then goes right for one bolt then back left to a ledge.
content.location: Just right of Warrior Without a Cause.
